summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs requires its medical centers to review a doctor’s care if quality or safety concerns arise. If the concerns are substantiated, medical center officials are required to inform hospitals and other health care entities by reporting the doctors to a national database and to the states where the doctor is licensed. title: VA Health Care: Improved Oversight Needed for Reviewing and Reporting Providers for Quality and Safety Concerns
